blocks.text: 10. Find the mean value of \( p \), when \( p \leq 550 \), for the range of \( n \) from 0 to 10.

11. The illumination \( I \) (foot candles) at a point is produced by a light source placed \( 2 \) feet above the ground, and at \( d \) feet from the foot of the lamp is given by: \( I = \frac{C}{d^2} \). Find the mean value of \( C \) when \( C \) ranges from \( 0 \) to \( 100 \).
12. Find the mean value of 5 in \( 6 x 220 \) for \( 1 \leq n \leq 10 \).

blocks.caption: Figure showing the values of the side thrust on the piston of the 1600 lb. hydraulic press. The side thrusts are denoted by angles A, B, and C.
blocks.description: The figure illustrates how the angles (A, B, C) relate to the side thrusts acting on the piston and the impact of these forces in a hydraulic press system. It visually conveys the relationships between these components as they affect the operation of the press.

blocks.text: Plot these values, determine the mean value, and therefore determine the mean side thrust for each current may be measured by the heat effect.

blocks.latex: H = C R I ^ 2 \quad \text{where } C \text{ is the heat unit } H.
blocks.description: This equation relates the heat effect \( H \) to the current \( I \) and resistance \( R \), providing a formula for calculating the heat generated in a given electrical circuit.

blocks.text: It shall be seen that \( H \) or \( C ^3 \) are the measuring instruments used to obtain the root of the mean value of this heating effect, i.e., the square root of the.
